title: Do you want to be a part of the Regulatory Policy Committee?

content.text: The RPC is currently recruiting for members. If you believe you have the experience and skills to be a member of the committee and offer comments and insight into the analysis and evidence underpinning regulatory proposals, we would be pleased to consider your application.

In his introduction to the candidate pack, Jonathan Reynolds, Secretary of State for Business and Trade, confirms the government’s commitment to the role of the RPC: “My cabinet colleagues and I believe this is a vital function that helps the government to make better informed decisions.”

Stephen Gibson, RPC Chair, says: “This is an exciting committee to serve on - we comment on the analysis supporting a wide range of proposals from banning plastic straws to energy efficiency measures for domestic buildings to Covid vaccination regulations. There is always an interesting new issue to consider and you would be joining a friendly and supportive team of like-minded experts.”
More information can be found in the candidate pack. Our recent blogpost offers insights into the role from two of our recently appointed members.
The deadline for applications is end of Wednesday 23 October. Interviews are likely to take place in early December.
